intro: Doxantha dasyonyx, commonly known as the velvetleaf spurge, is a flowering plant native to tropical and subtropical regions. It is characterized by its succulent, fleshy leaves and clusters of small, yellow flowers. The plant belongs to the Euphorbiaceae family, known for its diverse and often ornamental members. Doxantha dasyonyx is often grown as a decorative plant due to its unique appearance and ability to thrive in various conditions. It is important to note that some species in this family can be toxic, so handling should be done with care.
